page.title: 01Ringland - East to Taverham
page.content: There are two villages linked by the meandering River Wensum.{Ringland still has several old village families and is a small village in a rural area of agricultural and wooded land. Western{Taverham}incorporates most of the oldest & some of the newer housing. It is now a large residential village, popular because of facilities and proximity to{Norwich.}1981 census population{Ringland 170,Taverham 4314. Both villages are without street lighting and{Ringland's}unpaved roads are unfenced secondary. The A1067 {Norwich to Fakenham}road runs along {Taverham's}northern border. There are very sparse shopping, health or education amenities now actually in{Ringland}but Taverham has the whole range of these facilities and a health centre all available for {Ringland}people to use. (Mrs.S.Solly)
